Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tudor W
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and had a wonderful time, although we were initially given a double room when we had booked a twin we were moved the next morning. Whenever we left the hotel or on our return we were always greeted with a friendly smile. The rooms were very clean and my daughter was very thankful for the Wifi !! couldn't recommend this hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Beau...tiful!”
Reviews.Author: Doug J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Rome and thoughly enjoyed our time and experience. Max and Linda were very easy to communicate with (English) and helpful during our stay. They directed us to some excellent authentic Italian resturants. The location is convient and the room was larger than we expected. Excellent location as all major attractions are within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo D
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Rome, and our stay at Beau Site was wonderful. Thanks to Fabrizzio and Linda who made us feel so welcome. The hotel is a small place but with all of the amenities that you would need, minibar, WiFi, clean room etc.. They were courteous and helpfull, made lots of suggestions for great places for dinner and places to go. Would like to thank them for making our stay part of a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “only OK!”
Reviews.Author: JonK1028
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome, we were there for two nights. Good: not a bad location, very close to Metro Spagna station and spanish steps. Room was clean and bed sheets were in good quality. Bad: Hot water ran out of me in the middle of my shower. I had my shower done around 8:30am and guessed other customers used all they had. Breakfast was below average compares with other places we stayed in the same trip in Rome. Coffee taste like something from dollar stores here in US. "Aged" fresh fruits were served. You can see small flies around the breakfast area, they were probably from the "darken" bananas. I had diarrhea that day, not saying it was from the breakfast but probably a candidate. Also Just downstair at the corner of via Cadore and via Via Ludovisi there are two bars/restaurants. If you stay there over Friday/Sat nights, be aware they have loud music and customers all past midnight. To aware there are steps to use their elevator up or down stairs. If you are single female and carry a heavy luggage, this is a concern.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks a lot for everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana_Sh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Beau Site in July for a week. It was great time for us first of all because of our wedding. And I'd like to tell thank's a lot to all staff for great service which we had there. Especial thank's to Violetta for hot tea and coffe in the morning, for advice in restaurante choise, for organisation hairdressers for our friends and of course for welcoming at atmosphere in our wedding day for all our guests. Thanks a lot to Slava and all reception staff for made us feel like at home, for good advices and for your help. We definitely come back. )))) As you don't undestand - rooms clean and very nice. Location is perfect. Here everything is perfect! )))) And ones more - THANK YOU VERY VERY MUCH!

Reviews.Title: “Exciting Stay”
Reviews.Author: vacation60795
Reviews.Content: Maximilian & the entire staff made us feel like family. Very helpful advice & gladly made any arrangments we needed. Genuine & courteous. Satisfying continental breakfast. Rooms clean & very nice. Would highly recommend. Frank & Lorraine

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room - in a good location”
Reviews.Author: mrsd33
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at Beau Site and we had a great time. Our room was very comfortable and beautifully clean. We had a huge bed - which my husband thought was more comfortable than our one at home (praise indeed!) The staff there were very friendly and although they don't speak much English, and our Italian is non existent, they tried their best and were very helpful and welcoming. They looked things up on the internet for us to give us opening times of various places etc. The residence is close to the Spanish Steps - and there are lots of restaurants in the locality if you don't want to go too far for an evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “OK, if all you want is a clean quiet bed”
Reviews.Author: mrsa40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for 3 nights over a weekend. The place is perfectly OK. On the plus side the building is impressive and the staff are very pleasant. The residence (for that is what it is) is scrupulously clean, the beds are quite comfortable and the room we stayed in initially (one of 6) was quiet despite overlooking Via Ludovisi. We were required to move to another room on our third night as our room had been requested by other guests. This was explained to us on the basis that 206 was a superior room to which we had been upgraded at no extra cost, and on the third night we would be moved back to a classic room (202). There was in fact very little difference between the rooms, 206 being slightly bigger, but I suspect the reality of the situation was that the new guests had read reviews on trip advisor saying that 202 was noisy and didn't want to stay there! It was a bit noisier being near the reception desk and we were woken early by an alarm clock and footsteps in the room above, but it wasn't so bad. On the down side, I cannot really understand the glowing reviews this place has received. I perhaps expected too much from the 4 star rating. The decor is, to me, dated and bland. The shower cubicle (in rooms 206 and 202 at least) was extremely small. My very tall husband couldn't really reach his feet! Stick to tea at breakfast as the black coffee is instant and the cappuccino from a machine - a bit disappointing in the barista capital of the world! The lovely Italian lady on the desk in the evening, who didn't speak English, was unable to suggest where we might be able to get a good pizza, which you might have expected, though she did at least tell us about an area where many restaurants could be found. I would think the proprietor himself might have been more help in this regard but he was off duty all weekend. In short, whilst the Beau Site was basically fine it in no way enhanced our stay in Rome. If you are looking for just a clean quiet bed, great, but if you want somewhere with a little quirkiness and romance, this definitely isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: GordyNic
Reviews.Content: This place is a little gem! Perfectly situated in a lovely central neighbourhood- easy walking distance to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the metro which means anywhere is easily accessible. Massimiliano, Maya and the other staff made us very welcome and nothing was too much trouble for them be it recommendations or directions. A really comfortable and relaxing base- don't miss this place! Thanks very much for a great stay!ps- don't miss the wee bar/cafe opposite the hotel too, Bar Ludovisi.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, at walking distance from major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Abecede
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beau site for only one night, with my six year old daughter. I could say nothing bad about this hotel: extremely clean, wonderful staff, marvellous position, it made our stay in Rome perfect. I highly recommend it to those who search for a different type of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hospitality and above average stay in one of Rome's best neighborhoods”
Reviews.Author: Mariabgr
Reviews.Content: Fair priced accomodation for a spacious room, in one of Rome's best neighborhoods. Really close to Via Veneto, Trinita dei Monti, Piazza di Spagna, Piazza Barberini and Villa Borghese. The director of the hotel - Massimiliano, his parents and the staff were all very kind and helpful, even if they could not all speak english very well - special thanks to Maya for her help and advise in what to see and where to eat. The room was really clean and comfy. We had a general feeling that we stayed in a friendly house and not in a hotel. We would definitely go back next time we are in Rome, we do recommend it without a doubt - but have in mind that you stay in a small "hotel" with only 5-6 rooms, which means you don't have all the luxuries or the formalities of a huge tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, nice room”
Reviews.Author: travelwhenwecan5960
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Beau Site in a superior double room for three nights in late May and very much enjoyed our stay. The hotel on the 2nd floor (third by US standards) in a beautiful building. The rooms was very clean with a firm but comfortable bed and quality furnishingsand we were able to sleep very well . It was very warm during our visit and the AC worked great allowing us to adjust the room temperature to our likeing. The bathroom was updated with modern fixtures but the shower stall was a little tight. Breakfast was fine with yogurts, pastries, juice, and good coffee choices. The area was nice to walk around at night really enjoyed restaurant Vladimero around the corner from the hotel. The staff was helpful and professional especially the young lady who worked the front desk at night (forget her name).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with a few minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: mrcritique
Reviews.Content: Beau Site is a one floor, five guest rooms, hotel that is owner occupied. It is on the second story of a business/residence building that is under some renovation. It has the feel of staying in someone's home. That is both good and bad. The Beau Site has finished its' beautiful renovation, but there is still some minor noise from the restoration of other parts of the building. Hammering can be heard weekdays during the day but is generally not a problem. The interior is nicely decorated, carpeted, clean, has satellite television with multiple language access, internet connections via your laptop (in the rooms only), and new marbled bathrooms. The location is superb in that it is near to Villa Borghese and the Spanish Steps, yet away from much of the noise that permeates life in Rome. Still, there is a restaurant on the street that generates some noise that can be heard through the windows. More irritating is the telephone calls and entry ringer (there is a door buzzer you must use to gain access from the street to the building and hotel) that occur at the front desk and echo through the main hall into the rooms. The busier the hotel and the more people come and go, the more you hear the buzzer and telephone. It was not that busy when we were there, but the noise sure was noticeable. We stayed in room 201, which is closest to the front desk, so we may have been more impacted. There is also some room to room noise. We heard voices a little to distinctly, the television from the next room, and the teenage girls chatting until 2 am. Note to the owner: "Bigfoot" lives above room 201 and when he "walks" around his apt/condo, the light fixture on the ceiling of 201actually rattles. It might be a good idea to try to secure the fixture to preserve some sleep for the guests (and maybe send some cushy slippers to "Bigfoot"). Most disappointing was the breakfast. We expect quite a bit more for $25 per person. Service is poor, as the owners or their one helper eventually get around to serving coffee or cleaning a table. They need to be more proactive. Hot food is an extra cost and is not worth it. Avoid the omelets. The breakfast buffet consisted of elderly corn flakes/choco puffs, 2 juices, milk, leftover rolls, packaged "sweet" rolls, yogurt, and an occasional croissant. Totally inadequate. You can get bacon, eggs, coffee and bread for 10 euros down the street. Not that I expect bacon and eggs with the buffet, but some fresh fruit, a protein, granola, cheeses, meats, fresh jams and croissants would greatly improve the spread. Our hotel in Barcelona (Villa Emilia) the week before had all of these things and more for the same money, including homemade marmalade, prosciutto, ham, hard boiled eggs, fresh cream filled and chocolate pastries, multiple cheeses, cappuccinos, and Cava sparkling wine. Until there is a change in the offerings, have breakfast elsewhere. Because the owners don't speak English, and our rudimentary Italian was inadequate, we were unable to communicate very well. The lone English speaker on the staff was rarely there, especially when we needed them. The owners seem to be very nice people, and have a lovely place that is full of potential, but need to address the noise and breakfast issues before we can recommend Beau Site to others.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with family in their beautiful home”
Reviews.Author: SusanNY3312
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beau Site with my 2 teenage sons and my parents from Dec 26th 2009 thru Jan. 2nd 2010. The accomodations were amazing. We felt very safe and the block was quiet. The rooms were immaculate, spacious and comfortable. The bathrooms were state of the art, although the showers were a little difficult to navigate at first. The location was within walking distance to many restaurants, the Metro, the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. When we wanted to go farther, Luigi called a cab for us. Breakfast was more than enough and included cakes, yogurt, cereal, milk, fruit and juice. If I am fortunate to visit Rome again, I would definately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good.”
Reviews.Author: AverageJoeLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent effort from the staff to make your stay comfortable. Very clean, good facilities. Very enhusiastic owner. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small quite Hotel in idea location for Romes sites.”
Reviews.Author: Globle-Executive
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for all tourist sites in Rome. Situated just 5-8 mins walk from either Spagna or Barberini Metro station, it is in an idea location for easy reach from the main airport of Rome. The hotel is actually a Bouteque, and is loacted within an apartments / Office block that is on the second floor. The owner converted this with a total renovation to a high standard after managing other hotels for many years, deciding to buy and run his own a year ago. Luigi the owner welcomed us personally upon our arrival. He kindly carried out heavy case up the stairs to the second floor. Yes as previous reviews mention, there is some restoration works on going in the building reception area and the stairwells, but this is limited to this area only, and did not bother us in any way. From what we have seen, the finished work so far, will highly complement the rest of the building once finished. But please do not let this put you off a stay at this hotel, it is the stairwell not the hotel or rooms being renovated. Once we got to the hotels reception Luigi kindly upgraded us to there master room which was a complete surprise, of which he kindly showed us round including showing us the standard rooms so as to compare with the Master room. The Standard rooms are to as the same high standard as the master, however slightly smaller in size. He then also brought us homemade cakes was a lovely touch. All parts of the hotel were spotlessly clean with no fault with any part. The rooms come with a quite type fridge, and a digital room safe large enough for a laptop. Also a 40+inch plasma and Sky TV. All rooms and areas of the hotel being finished to a high standard decor. Luigi and his family cant be any more helpful than they were during our stay. He would provide us with maps and recommendations for places to visit, right down to informing us if we were wearing the correct clothing to visit certain sites in Rome. Breakfast was a Buffy type, with fresh bread rolls, and freshly made pastry's, Cereals and yogurts. The only thing that would have been nice would have been some cold meats / cheeses maybe, but otherwise was perfectly fine. As a summery - Excellent hotel, Very friendly staff, Great location, extremely clean, Would I stay again ? Most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: gsol
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at Beau Site for a week at Christmas. I am very familiar with Rome and in the past, have stayed in several more blazoned hotels hence, was pleasantly surprised by the size and furnishing of the room (simple yet elegant) by a very modern and well equipped bath room and especially by the owner/manager who was very attentive and did everything possible to make our stay a remarkable experience. The breakfast, included in the price was excellent. The location is the best, quiet but only 2 minutes from Via Veneto and 10 minutes from the Spanish Steps. We highly recommend this establishment and plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beau Site Hotel made our first trip to Rome special.”
Reviews.Author: bARABARAbeverley
Reviews.Content: Beautiful building in great location, very stylish comfortable rooms where nothing was too much trouble for Luigi and his lovely family . Can,t wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “i don't understand who wrote good reviews about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: TelAvivNoa
Reviews.Content: we booked at this hotel because of the great reviews and we were shocked of what we found. the hotel was renevated. the bulding was soraunded of bulding construction, the stairways were dirty and the construction works made lots of noise. we decided not to stay there. louidji the owner said that it was writen about cleaning jpbs- the building was'nt only cleaned it was renaveted. louidji helped us to find another hotel, but he chared us a night's cost because we had to cancel. it is not a hotel- it is a hostel

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here by chance”
Reviews.Author: JudithHighPeak
Reviews.Content: Due to an overbooking at a nearby hotel we were taken here. We were very well looked after and much attention has been given to detail. The home made breakfast cakes and pastries are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: Q80s
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a holiday where we could indulge ourselves in a romantic quiet atmosphere. Our internet search lead us to Beau Site. We were treated to an exceptional experience. A change of plan meant we needed to stay longer. The online booking did not allow us to book the same room type for the duration of our stay. On arrival, late in the afternoon, we were met and warmly welcomed by Luigi the Hotel proprietor. He immediately offered us an upgrade from the double superior to the junior suite at a reduced rate. This was just the beginning of an outstanding experience. Our room, just like the hotel was nicely scented and was fitted to the highest standard. Elegant furniture with tasteful touches. A real plant that was changed a few days later to a Christmas Poinsettia. A 42 inch plasma TV with it’s own satellite tuner that receives pay as well free to air channels from all over the world. The bathroom, just like the room, was very clean and fitted to the highest standard. Sheets and towels were changed daily. A bathrobe and slippers completed the 5 star treatment. The breakfast buffet that we saw on the site photos turned out to be completely misleading. Far from being meager, it was complemented by freshly baked pies and cakes prepared by Luigi’s wife, Rita. This is when you start feeling at home. Luigi and Rita go out of their way to make you feel welcomed. Coffee is prepared fresh to your taste, complementary dishes of cheese and cold cuts appeared on regular bases to help you sample Italian specialties. Both Luigi and Rita were always forthcoming with information and advice about Rome, the attractions and the shopping. Just to complete the package, Beau Site is central to several great attractions such as the Spanish Steps and Fontana del Tritone. It is close to both Spagna and Barberini Metro stations. And if you are there for the shopping, it is a few minutes walk from the prestigious Via Condotti where all the designer shops are and many smaller boutiques. We couldn’t have chosen a better place for our getaway. We felt at home yet we were in Rome 2000 miles away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: PICAEstoril
Reviews.Content: We love to be in Beausite and also the sympathy of Luiji and Rita. The room was very good, sufficiently spacious and clean with everything that was necessary, the service was perfect, with an exclusive breakfast. Nicely decorated with simple things, but very comfortable. It is situated in a central area, quiet and very near the historic center, we could go on foot to almost everywhere.
